newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy has 3.089 trln lire Feb non-EU trade surplus.
newsitem.headline: Italy has 3.089 trln lire Feb non-EU trade surplus.

text.p: Italy had a 3.089 trillion lire trade surplus with non-European Union countries in February, the national statistics office ISTAT said.
ITALY TRADE BALANCE (NON-EU) Feb 97 Jan 97 Feb 96
Cumulative yr to date +3.562 trln +451 trln +2.453 trln
Imports yr to date 21.934 trln 11.280 trln 22.736 trln
Exports yr to date 25.496 trln 11.731 trln 25.189 trln
Istat gave the following breakdown for the trade balance with European Union countries for January.
Note -- Istat said that Italy had a global trade surplus in January of 1.655 trillion lire against a surplus of 135 billion lire in January 1996.
